standard_metadata.standard_description: Express a fraction with denominator 10 as an equivalent fraction with denominator 100, and use this technique to add two fractions with respective denominators 10 and 100.

question.content: **Use the following image to complete the equation.**    $\dfrac{47}{100}={\dfrac4{10}}+{\dfrac{a}{100}}$  ${a}=$

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. The top 4 rows are shaded blue. In the fifth row, the left 7 squares are shaded green.

hints.content: We are adding fractions with different denominators: $\blue{\text{tenths}}$ and $\green{\text{hundredths}}$.
Let's break $\dfrac{47}{100}$ into $\blue{\text{tenths}}$ and $\green{\text{hundredths}}$.   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Two squares, one  square divided into 10 equal-sized rows. The top 4 rows are shaded blue. A second square divided into ten equal size rows made up of ten equal-sized squares. In the fifth row, the left 7 squares are shaded green. A plus sign separates the two squares.

question.content: **Use the following number line to complete the equation.**     ${\dfrac{15}{100}}={\dfrac{r}{10}}+{\dfrac5{100}}$  ${r}=$

images.alt: A number line labeled zero-tenths to three-tenths, with tick marks at zero-tenths, one-tenth, two-tenths, and three-tenths labeled and emphasized. Tick marks are at every hundredth unit. A pink arrow starting at zero-tenths moves right along the number line pointing to the one-tenth tick mark. A green arrow starting at the one-tenth tick mark moves right along the number line pointing to a dot on the fifth tick mark between one-tenth and two-tenths labeled fifteen-hundredths.

hints.content: We are adding fractions with different denominators: $\pink{\text{tenths}}$ and $\green{\text{hundredths}}$.

A pink arrow starting at zero-tenths moves right along the number line pointing to the one-tenth tick mark with a bracket above it labeled one-tenth. A green arrow starting at the one-tenth tick mark moves right along the number line pointing to a dot on the fifth tick mark between one-tenth and two-tenths. A bracket above the green arrow is labeled five-hundredths.
